column4: iam using kubuntu. i just restored a backuped image of hdb2. at boot it says 'failed to open journal device. unknow block 0.0. ext3 journal in .... something.  and its not mounting.   what can i do? (i think the backup i made didnt supported linux partitions
if your backup prog didn't support ext3 you are probably screwed,  check the maker's site for info
all files seem ok. i used them.
how can you use the files if you can't mount the drive ?
the site give no option. iam left with just to repair it. how can i?
i already resotred the image and booted. the mesg came at boot.   i think its the problem with journal or something
if you can still access the files, copy them somerwhere else and repartitons that drive,  then move them back
yes. that was i thinkg about. how can i repare
read again, all the way throught his time
what do you want me to read
read carefully, I will not type this again,
copy the files somewhere else,   then use gparted to delete the borked partition, and reformat it , the copy the files back over to that partiton
oh sory. repartion.. well the drive is repared. the linux installation is messed.  all i was asking is how can i repair the journal proble
do you know how to repair journal problem
I gave you my suggestion, follow it or not,  do not ask again
theres nothing wrong with the drive. installation is messed. i dont know how to correct. any way. thanks
